results.title: The Sure thing
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Roger Birnbaum and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Walt Gibson, “Gib”, is a college freshman from the East Coast obsessed with “scoring”. After striking out with fellow student, Alison - the control freak, he decides to head west to California after his best friend assures him of a “sure thing”. What Gib doesn’t know is that Alison is also planning a trip to California to visit her stuffy fiancee. They end up sharing the same ride and misadventures, which ultimately draws them together. Cast includes: John Cusack, Daphne Zuniga, Boyd Gaines, Tim Robbins, Lisa Persky and Anthony Edwards.

results.title: Lady Windermere's fan
results.brief_description: Based on Oscar Wilde’s stage play about a woman who narrowly avoids causing a scandal in London society. The first and most melodramatic of his four social comedies, this silent film version was directed by former actor Fred Paul. It is a typical example of British feature films from this period with the actors giving essentially stage-crafted performances. Although the play was substantially altered for this screen version, it is still shot as if it was theatre with the camera taking up a fixed frontal position. A new specially commissioned musical soundtrack composed and conducted by Nicholas Brown and performed by the Triptych piano trio has been added. Cast includes Milton Rosmer, Netta Westcott and Nigel Playfair.

results.title: The Amateur gentleman
results.creator_credit: Thornton Freeland, Douglas Fairbanks, Hal Roach, Marcel Hellman, Criterion Films and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film takes place in 1810 England. The hero is Barnaby Barty (Douglas Fairbanks Jr), son of a country innkeeper who is wrongly accused of theft during a visit from Royalty - the Marquis of Camberhurst and his son, Lord Chichester (Basil Sydney). To prove his dad innocent of a crime, Barnaby poses as a famous bare-knuckle gentleman prizefighter. He travels to London and gets involved with London society, royalty, murder and intrigue in his quest to save his father. Based on a novel of the same title by Jeffrey Farnol. Cast includes: Elissa Landi, Margaret Lockwood, Coral Browne, Irene Browne, Gilbert Davis, Gordon Harker, Esme Percy, Frank Pettingell, Athole Stewart and Hugh Williams. Cinematographer: Gunther Krampf.

results.title: Notting Hill
results.creator_credit: Roger Mitchell, Duncan Kenworthy and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hugh Grant plays William Thacker, owner of a travel bookstore in London’s Notting Hill. A chance visit to his store by famous American movie star, Anna Scott, played by Julia Roberts, sparks a complicated romance between the two. The worlds of celebrity and everyday people in collision creates a series of misunderstandings and dilemmas which divide and reunite the pair on more than one occasion. In an adventurous finale William rallies his ensemble of old friends and a mad flatmate to try one last time to get the girl. A British romantic comedy from the makers of “Four Weddings and a Funeral”. Cast also includes Hugh Bonneville, Emma Chambers and James Dreyfus.

results.title: Joseph and the amazing technicolor dreamcoat
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Steven Pimlott, Andrew Lloyd Webber and Really Useful Films
results.brief_description: The first musical blockbuster by the immensely successful Rice and Weber song writing duo, this straight-to-video recording of the spectacular stage production features Donny Osmond as Joseph. Based on the Biblical story of Joseph and his coat of many colors. Joseph is the favorite son of Jacob (Richard Attenborough), but his eleven brothers resent the attention their father showers upon him and sell him into slavery. Eventually, the favored son finds himself in jail, however his favorable interpretation of the dreams of the Pharaoh win him the admiration of the all-powerful leader, and soon Joseph is one of the most powerful men in Egypt. Songs include ‘Close Every Door to Me, ‘Go Go Go Joseph’ and ‘Any Dream Will Do’. Cast also includes Joan Collins and David Grindrod.

results.title: Buried country
results.creator_credit: Andy Nehl, Liz Watts, Film Australia and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the history of Aboriginal country music over six decades, revealing how Aboriginal Australians have long been inspired by country music and have used it to tell their stories - of everyday life, the connection to the land, the fight for land rights and the struggle for equality. It combines rare archival images and recordings, interviews with musicians, including Jimmy Little, Harry and Wilga Williams, Bob Randall, Roger Knox, Bobby McLeod, Vic Simms, Auriel Andrew, Lionel Rose, Herbie Laughton, Galarrwuy Yunupingu and Troy Cassar-Daley, who speak about the challenges of performing, the discrimination they have faced and the support they have received. The film is both a celebration of the rich tradition of Aboriginal country music and a moving record of indigenous Australia. Based on the book of the same name by Clinton Walker. For further information about the film and related material visit http://buriedcountry.com

results.title: What becomes of the broken hearted?
results.creator_credit: Ian Mune, Bill Gavin and Sequel Productions
results.brief_description: It’s five years from where “Once were warriors” left us, and Jake the Muss has turned his back on his family - breaking old habits is not as easy. His long suffering wife, Beth (Rena Owen), has left him and is living with someone new. Jake too has started a new relationship which is punctuated by violence and alcohol abuse. He is reunited with Beth and younger son, Sonny (Clint Eruera), at the funeral of Nig, who died in a gang fight. Tensions flare between Jake and Sonny, and as Sonny delves deeper into the dangerous world of gangs to gain retribution for his elder brother’s death, Jake must face, once and for all, the demons of the past and open up to the possibility of change, and survival.

results.title: The Thin red line (Malick)
results.creator_credit: Terrence Malick, John Roberdeau, Robert Michael Geisler and Phoenix Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on James Jones’ tough, autobiographical novel about a group of young soldiers landing at Guadalcanal Island to fight the Japanese, Terrence Malick’s “The Thin Red Line” stands comparison with the greatest of war movies. The narrative shifts from Private to General, from Lieutenant to Seargent, a continuous fragmented voice-over in which the audience is made to confront the fears and terrors that every soldier must face in battle. Malick contrasts the lush savage beauty of the Solomon Islands with the glistening weapons of war brought in by the Americans and the Japanese, and the film moves from becoming the story of a battle to becoming a tragically moving anti-war epic. That Malick is able to see the suffering and humiliation of war and defeat, while making a film about one of the most successful American campaigns in World War II history, is a testament to his commitment to universalist humanist values. The outstanding musical score, blending classical, western and Polynesian music, is by Hans Zimmer; the ravishing cinematography is by John Toll. In a cast distinguished by fine ensemble playing, Sean Penn, Jim Caviezel, Nick Nolte and Elias Koteas are outstanding. Winner of the Golden Bear at the Berlin Film Festival and nominated for 7 Academy Awards (it lost out to “Saving Private Ryan”).

results.title: The Young poisoner's handbook
results.creator_credit: Benjamin Ross, Sam Taylor, Mass Productions and Sam Taylor Productions
results.brief_description: 14 year old Graham’s experience with a failed science experiment leads him into a life long obsession with poisons and their effect on those around him. Failing to do away with his first victim - his best friend - Graham charts the slow demise of his step-mother, in the interim maiming his older sister. Once the young poisoner’s crimes are discovered, he is detained in a centre for the criminally insane. From this point on Graham’s battle with redemption and the desire for infamy are followed with dark humour. Deemed to be beyond his unfortunate psychopathic beginnings, Graham finds life outside of ‘Harshurst’ all too seductive for a young poisoner to bare, his new colleagues coming to this realisation just a little too late. Based on the true story of the St Alban’s poisoner.

results.title: Suspicion
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A dowdy and repressed young woman, a colonel’s daughter who has led a sheltered life, is irresistibly attracted to a man who is romantic and reckless, a rejection of everything her family background and upbringing have stood for. After their marriage she finds that he is a liar and, she suspects, a murderer. She comes to believe that he plans to murder her. Although the ending is apparently not what Hitchcock originally intended, the film as it now stands does not run counter to his interest in the themes of paranoia and the fragility of relationships. Cast includes Cary Grant, Joan Fontaine, Sir Cedric Hardwicke, Nigel Bruce and Dame May Whitty. Adapted from the novel ‘Before the Fact’ by Francis Iles.
